result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maria C. Alvarez

records.addlTxt:
08:51 AM Defendant, Maria C. Alvarez, appeared with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri.
Attorney Christine Ann Gabron in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Spanish interpreter, Ruth Garcia, appeared in court.
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Interpreter sworn-in.
Victim rights compliance.
Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1-Fel Poss of Narcotic Drugs & Ct 2-Misd Theft-Mov Prop;
Judgment withheld, 24 month hold open agreement entered into.
Sign. bond cont'd.  Interpreter requested for next hrg.
Deferred Prosecution hearing scheduled for June 5, 2024 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant, Maria C. Alvarez, appeared with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri with span interpreter Reme Bashi.  Attorney Christine Ann Gabron appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

121PM    State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Francesco Balistrieri.  Interpreter Reme Bashi.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on April 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued as previously set.  ts

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Maria C. Alvarez, appeared with Span int Patrick Ryan.   Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:    SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Dorthye D, Suzanne J, Debra P - for employment only, Manor Care 3100 Washington Rd.

01:44 PM    State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin, appeared in court.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on February 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  DE understands and reads English but requests Interpreter for court proceeding.  ts
and witness list filed by the State
